[English]:

src_text: 作為國家安全顧問，他協助卡特在外交上處理國際事務，例如 1978 年的大衛營協議；1970 年代末實現美中關係正常化；1979 年導致伊朗人質危機的伊朗革命；及1979 年蘇聯入侵阿富汗。
ref_text: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.
hyp_text: As National Security Advisor, he assisted Carter in the management of foreign affairs and the execution of foreign policy. In the international field, he engaged with Sino-American relations leading to the United States' normalization of relations with the People's Republic of China, and also worked on the Middle East peace negotiations. The Camp David Accords in 1978 between Israel and Egypt resulted in Brzezinski being awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Brzezinski's tenure was also arduous on the domestic front as the Iran Revolution and the Iran hostage crisis strained his already tense relationship with Secretary of State Cyrus Vance. Brzezinski served on the faculty of Harvard University from 1953 to 1960, and of Columbia University from 1960 to 1989. While teaching at Columbia, he also headed the Institute on Communist Affairs. He was a member of the policy planning staff of the U.S. State Department from 1966 to 1968. Afterwards, while serving in the Carter administration, he became concerned about the imminent Soviet invasion of Afghanistan and, with the support of Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the People's Republic of China, he created a strategy to arm and finance the mujahideen fighting against the Soviet invasion. From 1981 to 1989, Brzezinski was affiliated with the Center for Strategic and International Studies in Washington, D.C. He was also a member of the Chemical Weapons Working Group (CWWG). In 1988, Brzezinski was co-chairman of the Bush National Security Advisory Task Force. Brzezinski was a leading critic of the 2003 invasion of Iraq. In August 2007, he endorsed Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama. In September 2007, Brzezinski published an opinion piece in which he publicly called for Obama to be elected president in the 2008 presidential election. In a September 2012 interview with The Daily Beast, Brzezinski suggested the United States should retarget its nuclear weapons towards Iran. Brzezinski died on May 26, 2017, at Inova Fairfax Hospital in Falls Church, Virginia, at the age of 89.

hyp_text: Traditionally, not all Sami have been connected to the reindeer herding industry. Some Sami people have relied on coastal fishing, and others have had a primarily hunter-gatherer lifestyle. Even some Sami who have hunted (mainly for bear, beaver, squirrel, and wolf) have used reindeer as a decoy animal. For example, a person who needs a squirrel skin might lure the squirrel with a decoy reindeer by tying a string between two trees adjacent to a squirrel's home. The squirrel is caught when it touches the string, which is attached to a trigger that causes a bent stick to straighten, knocking the squirrel to the ground. The Sami people's use of the reindeer has always included milk, cheese, meat, blood, sausage, and cooking on a tripod over an open fire. Reindeer have been important to the Sami culture because of their dependence on them, providing, for example, meat, hides, antlers (which can be used for handicrafts), transportation, and milk and its derivative products.
